Joint New Year Editorial Supported in Mexico
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial Supported in Mexico 
    Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- Ten political parties and organizations in Mexico including the Socialist Party, the People's Socialist Party, the Socialist Popular Party and the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on Jan. 14 in support of the joint New Year editorial issued by the newspapers of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Korean People's Army and the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League.
 The statement hailed the ways for reunification set forth in the joint editorial as the most just and realistic ways as they represent the desire of all the Korean people and the reality of the Korean Peninsula.
 Holding that Korea should be reunified in line with the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo and in the idea of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration, the statement expressed full support for the Korean people in the dynamic patriotic movement for independent reunification, peace against war and overall national unity under the banner of "By our nation itself".    
 It demanded the U.S. stop standing in the way of Korea's reunification and pull back its troops from south Korea at once, calling on the governments of all countries in the world to support the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea.

articles.title: Struggle of Korean People Supported
articles.content:
Struggle of Korean People Supported 
    Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- Niculae Pavelescu, vice-chairman of the Left United Party of Romania, said that his party will always stand by the Korean people striving to build socialism and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the Songun politics and positively support their struggle.
 In a statement titled "The Songun politics of Comrade Kim Jong Il is invincible" published on Jan. 18 on the occasion of February 16, he said:
 Thanks to the Songun politics, the DPRK is winning victories one after another in political and military confrontation with the U.S. and bringing a beam of hope to the world people aspiring after justice and peace.    
 Witnessing the victorious struggle of the Korean people, we have come to realize that the Songun politics is a mighty political mode that firmly guarantees the prosperity of socialist Korea yesterday, today and tomorrow and that should be held faster to as long as the imperialists remain in the world.
 He expressed the conviction that as long as there is the Songun politics pursued by leader Kim Jong Il, the Korean people's struggle will be invincible.

articles.title: U.S. Escalated War Moves against DPRK Assailed
Permission of U.S. Forces' "Strategic Flexibility" Protested
Ultra-Right Conservatives' Vandalism under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Ultra-Right Conservatives' Vandalism under Fire in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- 17 south Korean human rights organizations including the Solidarity Meeting of Organizations to Honor Memory of Martyrs for the Nation and Democracy reportedly made public a statement on January 18 denouncing the ultra-right conservatives for their vandalism of desecrating the grave of Kim Nam Sik, former permanent advisor to Thongil News.
 Recalling that on Jan. 15 they perpetrated such rowdyism as painting black his gravestone in Namyangju City, Kyonggi Province, finding fault with the words of "pro-reunification patriot" inscribed on it, the statement noted with towering indignation that this was by no means accidental but carefully prearranged vandalism.    
 It demanded severe punishment of those who committed such inhuman atrocities.

Credentials Presented to Kim Yong Nam by Palestinian Ambassador
articles.content:
Credentials Presented to Kim Yong Nam by Palestinian Ambassador
    Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- Mohammad Shahta Zarab, Palestinian ambassador e. p. to the DPRK, presented his credentials to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today. 
 Present there were Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and a staff member of the Palestinian embassy here.
 After receiving the credentials, Kim Yong Nam had a talk with the Palestinian ambassador.
